description: Incas are a versatile civilization with strong military units and unique economic bonuses.
dark_age: Start with 4 villagers and a llama.
Build 2 houses, a mill near berries, and a mining camp near a gold mine.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Build a barracks and train 3-4 militia.
Use the llama to scout the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 10-12 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 600-800 food, 100-150 wood, and 50-100 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 6-7 villagers to food, 3-4 to wood, and 1-2 to gold and stone.
feudal_age: Build a blacksmith and market to upgrade infantry and sell excess resources for gold.
Build additional houses and train more villagers.
Build a second barracks and continue producing infantry units.
Advance to Castle Age at around 20-22 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1200-1500 food, 400-500 wood, 200-300 gold, and 150-200 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 5-6 to wood, 2-3 to gold, and 3-4 to stone.
castle_age: Build a siege workshop and start producing siege units.
Build a monastery and start training monks.
Research the unique technology, Andean Sling, for improved skirms and sling units performance.
Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 30-32 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 2500-3000 food, 1000-1200 wood, 800-1000 gold, and 600-800 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 12-15 to stone.
imperial_age: Train kamayuks and eagles as main infantry and raiding units.
Use siege units and monks to destroy buildings and convert enemy units.
Research the unique technology, Fabric Shields, for improved kamayuk performance.
Have a mix of farms, llama, and fishing ships for food, and gather enough wood, gold, and stone to support your army production.
Assign 40-50 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 25-30 to stone.
